resources.string: Please insert the title of the task
Please insert a description of the task
Great! You can complete all your tasks!
Try skipping low priority tasks. Then you can make it!
You’re able to complete medium and higher priority tasks
Skip low and medium priority tasks, focus on high!
You can complete all high priority tasks
Oh, you cannot complete all high priority tasks. Consider changing deadlines.
Tell mum to have a nice day
Welcome to DoItWithAndroid, since this is your first launch, lets take a look at how to use this awesome app
This is the main menu, use it to go navigate the application
"This is your level. You will earn experience by completing your tasks. Try to complete as many tasks as you can to become an effective person with a high level! "
This is your current experience and experience you need to reach a new level. Every new level will require more experience than the last. It will get harder over time, but you can do it!

"This is your working time remaining today. The timer will stop when you add a task, because the application assumes that you started working. When you complete a task, the timer will recalculate how much work there is left. "

Here are the tasks you should do today. You do not have to complete them in the given order, it is just recommended. Every task has its own colour based on its priority. RED means high, YELLOW is medium and GREEN is low. Experience gained per task is based on priority and duration. When you complete a task, simply swipe left to mark it as done.

Grey tasks are the same as normal tasks, the only difference is that when your tasks are grey, you are not in your productive hours. You can still complete tasks, but the planner will not count their duration to your working time left today, and their completion time will be same as their estimated time. Feel free to complete tasks outside of your productive hours, the planner will recalculate your schedule :)

"If you do not have enough productive time left today to fit in the whole task, or you have a task that is longer than you daily productive time, the task will be split into parts. This task will be displayed like any other, but a percentage, showing how much of the overall task each part contains will be displayed. "
If you swipe left on you current level, you will get to a quick overview of your tasks. Here you can see a summary of what you can achieve within your deadlines

"If you see this line as green - Great! If you complete all your tasks according to the schedule, you can do them all. Try to complete tasks as quickly as possible to see green as often as possible. "

"If the overview turns red, but this line is still green, you do not have to worry too much. This means that you are still able to complete all medium and high priority task and Do It With Android will prepare a plan to complete them. However if you see this line red, that means you are not able to complete all medium priority tasks. "

If all goes to red, but high priorities stay green, there is still hope. That means you are able to complete at least all your high priority tasks, the schedule will ignore lower priority tasks and will create a plan to complete the most important things. If you see this red, you have a problem. You will not be able to complete all your high priority tasks no matter what you do. You will have to work out of your working hours or you will have to change deadlines/priorities
Statistics screen is exactly what you expect. You can see the statistics about your progress, completed tasks and more. Just scroll down and look at everything you’ve already accomplished! :)
This action will close settings and will enable the tutorial to run once again. Do you want to run the tutorial again?
You should focus on this task
Welcome and Do It With Android!

"As mentioned before, you can enter your tasks and their deadlines. Each task has a title, a brief description, deadline, priority, estimated completion time and the time spent on the task. Try to give accurate time estimates for your tasks, as they are used for calculating your schedule, however, once the task is completed, the actual completion time will be used to adjust your schedule. Keep in mind the app only knows what you share with it, so you should be honest with completing your tasks, otherwise the app becomes less effective. "
Please set the time you normally become productive. For example after breakfast, or after your first morning coffee.
"Enter the time you normally stop being productive. This shouldn’t be the time just before you go to bed, but for example the time before having dinner, or before watching TV. "
Deadlines for some tasks have already passed
Welcome to the task screen. Here you can find all your tasks. From this screen you can add, delete and modify your tasks. You can also see the details of each task

"Here you can see all of your unfinished tasks. You can see their title, description, deadline (fire icon), estimated duration (clock icon) and more information on some of them. You will learn about this in just a moment. "
"When you complete just a part of your task, you will see how much of a task is completed as a percentage and as a small line under the task. "
If you want to edit a task press and hold it. To complete a task from this screen simply swipe RIGHT and to delete a task swipe LEFT.

"When you see the deadline icon (fire) with red color, that means that you have missed its deadline. You should revisit it, since the schedule does not take these tasks into account when calculating. "
Tasks that can not be completed

"When fire turns into red flashing exclamation mark, that means this task cannot be done within the deadline, even if you skip lower priority tasks. These tasks will not show on your daily tasks, as we think that it is better to complete smaller amounts on time, rather than missing more deadlines. "

"If you see a warning sign on a tasks priority strip, that means you cannot complete all tasks within their deadlines. This warning sign shows tasks you should focus on, as they have a higher priority. "

When you tap on archive tab, you will get to the task archive. All completed tasks are stored here, you can see information about these tasks, such as completion time and what was its real duration (tasks completed out of your working time will have their estimated time written here). If you want to reopen a task (in the case that you have a new similar task or that you are repeating a task), simply tap on that task and change any relevant data. If you swipe RIGHT you can delete a task from archive.
On top of the screen, you can see a quick status of your tasks, so you do not have to switch back to the home screen to see the status of your tasks
If red exclamation mark appears in top status bar, that means some of your tasks are already after deadline so you should be aware of that.
Tell mum to have a nice day

"Please be aware that the author is not responsible for any missed deadlines when using this application. The application is intended as a guide and not a guarantee. The author is not responsible for any deadlines missed while using this appplication. "
Hi I would like to report feedback on your app:
Task completed since its completion was over 100%
"Please insert the duration of the task "

"Thank you for installing this app. Do It With Android is designed to allow you to complete tasks more effectively and to reduce procrastination. Since this is your first time, we have to set a few things up to get you started. I hope you will enjoy the app and it will help you improve your time management. "
Productivity time lower than hour...You can do better!
